news.title: NBCC in discussion to secure 139-acre project in Seychelles
news.para: State-owned NBCC is exploring a major infrastructure project on a 139-acre island in Seychelles. The development will include housing, leisure facilities, and sports arenas. A high-level delegation from Seychelles visited NBCC's headquarters for detailed discussions. NBCC has a proven track record in similar projects, including in the Maldives.

news.title: Nexus Select Trust to pick 50% stake in Runwal Enterprises' upcoming mall in Mumbai for ₹434 crore
news.para: Nexus Select Trust  will acquire a 50 percent stake in a new mall in Mumbai. This deal is valued at Rs 434 crore. The upcoming mall is located in Dombivli. It will be operated in partnership with Runwal Enterprises. This acquisition is part of Nexus Select Trust's growth strategy.

news.title: Sunteck Realty strengthens sustainability credentials, scrores 78 in 2025 S&P Global ESG assessment
news.para: Sunteck Realty has achieved a remarkable score of 78 in the S&P Global Corporate Sustainability Assessment. This marks a significant improvement from its previous score. The company's commitment to sustainability is evident in its consistent year-on-year progress. Sunteck Realty also secured a 5-star rating and a score of 99 in the GRESB assessment.

news.title: Gurugram: 450 shanties built on land along Golf Course Road razed
news.para: District authorities in Gurugram demolished approximately 450 shanties in Saraswati Kunj, Sector 53, on Saturday as part of an ongoing crackdown on unauthorized settlements. The operation, conducted on government land and internal roads, followed previous drives and prior notices, aiming to prevent further encroachment and protect public access.

news.title: Unity Small Finance Bank likely to foray into housing finance business next fiscal
news.para: Unity Small Finance Bank, after missing out on Aviom India Housing Finance, is prioritizing strategic options over aggressive acquisitions. The bank plans to enter the housing finance business in the latter half of the year, focusing on affordable housing and micro-LAP, while also preparing for a public listing in approximately two to two-and-a-half years.

news.title: Google expands Bengaluru footprint, secures rights to 2.6 million sq ft at Alembic City
news.para: Google is significantly expanding its presence in Bengaluru's Whitefield, securing rights to approximately 2.6 million square feet at Alembic City. This move highlights the tech giant's sustained commitment to the region, with the landlord obligated to reserve additional office blocks exclusively for Google.

news.title: DDA grants approval for change of use in land pooling area in north-west Delhi
news.para: Delhi Development Authority has approved the change of land use for Sector-8B, marking the first area eligible for development under the city's Land Pooling Policy. This milestone was achieved after Sector-8B met the mandatory 70% contiguous pooled land threshold, paving the way for integrated urban development.

news.title: Over 2,200 Bengaluru development body homes lie unsold
news.para: Thousands of Bangalore Development Authority (BDA) flats and villas on the city's outskirts remain unsold despite lower pricing than private developers. Poor infrastructure, including lack of road connectivity and civic amenities, along with maintenance issues, are deterring buyers. Despite sales incentives, demand is lukewarm, leaving many units vacant.

news.title: Gurugram to enforce two-stage checks of demolition waste before construction and occupancy
news.para: Gurugram is implementing strict rules for construction and demolition waste. From April 1, all waste from sites of 200 sq metres or more must be traceable. Builders will declare expected debris and show receipts from authorized facilities. Civic bodies must ensure collection points every 5km. A digital tracking system will monitor all waste movement, making illegal dumping difficult.

news.title: Greater Bengaluru authority auctions seven properties in crackdown on ₹437 crore tax dues
news.para: Greater Bengaluru Authority (GBA) has initiated a crackdown on property tax defaulters, auctioning seven properties to recover long-pending dues. With ₹437 crore in arrears across nearly 7,000 units, authorities are using public auctions as a last resort. This move aims to recover unpaid taxes and ensure compliance from all property owners.

news.title: Over 1,400 illegal properties to be demolished in anti-encroachment drive in Rajkot
news.para: Rajkot Municipal Corporation has launched a massive anti-encroachment drive, demolishing 1,489 illegal properties along the Aji River and a municipal road in Jangleshwar. The operation, ordered by Deputy Chief Minister Harsh Sanghavi, involves over 1,200 officials and police personnel. Residents, some living in the area for decades, expressed anguish and uncertainty about their future, fearing homelessness.

news.title: BPTP to jointly develop 11-acre residential project in Surajkund, Faridabad
news.para: BPTP's subsidiary Urban Realtech is developing a large residential group housing project in Surajkund, Faridabad. The project will be built on an 11-acre land parcel. It is expected to have a developable area exceeding two million square feet. This venture aims to boost BPTP's regional portfolio and stakeholder value.

news.title: Banks can’t claim rights over flats booked to allottees: Rajasthan RERA
news.para: Rajasthan RERA has ruled that banks cannot claim rights over flats booked by allottees before a loan was created. The authority also stated that RERA proceedings can continue against builder directors and landowners even during insolvency. This order protects homebuyers in the Avalon Royal Park housing project, where a builder mortgaged the project after selling over 700 flats.

news.title: No misleading pre-launch advertisements, Telangana RERA warns developers
news.para: TG-RERA has warned developers and agents against misleading homebuyers with pre-launch advertisements lacking mandatory registration numbers. Projects requiring RERA registration are those exceeding 500 sq m or with more than eight units. Several entities, including Godrej Properties, received show-cause notices for non-compliance, with some ads failing to display registration numbers or adhering to guidelines.

news.title: NGT cracks whip on erring stone crushers to shield Shivalik Hills in Ropar
news.para: The National Green Tribunal has ordered the Punjab Pollution Control Board to strictly enforce environmental norms for stone crushers in Ropar district. Thirteen units found violating regulations and engaging in illegal mining have faced closure, environmental compensation, and criminal complaints. The board must now inspect remaining units and verify raw material sources within three months.

news.title: NCLAT directs withdrawal of the insolvency against Mahagun as parties arrives settlement
news.para: The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) has ordered the withdrawal of insolvency proceedings against realty firm Mahagun. This decision follows a settlement reached between Mahagun (India) and its financial creditor, IDBI Trusteeship, on February 12, 2026.

news.title: Karnataka RERA puts builders on notice over project updates
news.para: Karnataka RERA has initiated action against 155 promoters for failing to submit mandatory quarterly project reports. This move aims to enhance homebuyer rights and ensure builder accountability. Promoters face penalties for non-compliance, with a deadline set for March 31 to submit pending updates without charges.

news.title: Bengaluru's five civic bodies collects only 57.96% of their property tax target for 2025-26
news.para: Bengaluru's five new city corporations are struggling, collecting just 57.96% of their property tax target with the March deadline approaching. The South corporation leads at 60.65%, while North lags significantly at 52.48%.  Overall collections are down from last year, with administrative changes cited as a factor.  Achieving the full target now seems improbable.

news.title: Prayagraj: 375 hectares earmarked for housing in Jhunsi & Hetapatti
news.para: The Prayagraj Development Authority is acquiring approximately 375 hectares in Jhunsi and Hetapatti for large-scale residential and commercial development. The project, with an estimated investment of Rs 2,500 crore, aims to meet growing urban demand by providing planned spaces. Farmers will receive compensation at four times the prevailing circle rate.

news.title: Haryana assembly approves merger of housing board into HSVP
news.para: The Haryana Assembly has approved the merger of the 55-year-old Housing Board Haryana into Haryana Shehri Vikas Pradhikaran. This move consolidates housing functions. The government assured employee interests are protected. The Housing Board was established to provide affordable housing for various societal sections. It constructed over 95,000 houses, with a significant portion for lower-income groups.
